channel.title: Autism-101 provides resources for newly diagnosed Autistic people.
channel.description: Recent content on Autism-101 provides resources for newly diagnosed Autistic people.

item.title: My Autism Diagnosis in My Late 50’s
item.description: “See If You’re On The Spectrum!” read a link on social media.

item.title: Autism and Sensory Issues
item.description: My whole life I have struggled with the loudness of music and sounds.

item.title: Autism and Routines
item.description: There are many routines that I find myself doing. From wearing the same grey shirt every day to eating the same food.

item.title: Autism and Hyperfocus
item.description: One Autistic trait that I have is the ability to hyperfocus on something that I am really interested in.

item.title: In Sync
item.description: I got my Autistic diagnosis late last year as an older adult.

item.title: Autastic
item.description: About: Autastic exists as a home for the uncounted legion of adults worldwide who learned, well into adulthood, that they are (or might be) autistic.

item.title: AutiComm
item.description: About: Quite simply, AutiComm it’s an emergent peer-to-peer community of autistic folks.

item.title: Sounds Autistic
item.description: About: The Sounds Autistic I'm In is a private Facebook group for autistic adults that are 18+ only.

item.title: Wrong Planet
item.description: About: Wrong Planet is a web community designed for autistic individuals as well as parents and professionals of those with Autism, Asperger’s Syndrome, ADHD, PDDs, and other neurological differences.

item.title: Autistic Adults
item.description: About: Autistic Adults is a Facebook group that is for autistic adults that would like help and support to deal with anxiety, depression, and other emotional support.

item.title: Meetup
item.description: About: Meetup does have some autistic support groups and it is worth doing a search for groups in your area to see if there is one near you.

item.title: Autism-Forums
item.description: About: Autism Forums is a friendly forum to discuss Aspergers Syndrome, Autism, High Functioning Autism and related conditions.

item.title: ACEing Autism
item.description: About: ACEing Autism is on a mission for children with autism to grow, develop and benefit from social connections and fitness through affordable tennis programming.

item.title: Autistic resources for the newly diagnosed.
I Might Be Autistic. How Can I Tell?
Autism 101
item.description: I’m just an Autistic person who is trying to make sense of the world and my place in it.

item.title: Contact Us
item.description: How can I help you? Let me know! I will try my best to answer or point you in the right direction.

item.title: Functioning Labels
item.description: What’s The Big Deal? After being around the autistic community for a while, you will come across the use of functioning labels.

item.title: Privacy Policy
item.description: This privacy policy (“policy”) will help you understand how Autism-101 (“us”, “we”, “our”) uses and protects the data you provide to us when you visit and use autism-101.

item.title: Terms of Service
item.description: Please read these terms of service (“terms”, “terms of service”) carefully before using the Autism-101 website (the “service”) operated by Autism-101 (“us”, ‘we", “our”).
